name: agileQuestions
desc: Agile assessment which provides Multiple Choice Questions (MCQs) related to Core Agile Scrum.

questions.description: Who is responsible for prioritizing the product backlog?
questions.explanation: The product owner represents the customer and is accountable for ensuring that the team delivers value to the business. The product owner writes the customer-focused items (typically user stories), prioritizes them and adds them to the product backlog.

questions.description: Which one of the following is not a Scrum role?
questions.explanation: Scrum has only three roles and the relationship between these roles is clear and simple. There are also supporting roles, like product manager, but these are not part of Scrum itself -- albeit still important to its success.

questions.description: Which one of the following is not a Scrum artifact?
questions.explanation: In the purest sense of Scrum, there are only three clear artifacts: Product Backlog, Sprint Backlog and Burndown Chart. There is and always will be a strong argument for the inclusion of stories, and to be honest, they are something that I always include.

questions.description: Which of the following meetings is not part of Scrum?
questions.explanation: A product review meeting is not part of the formal sequence of meetings. There are primarily only three meetings within the Scrum environment. At the start of each Sprint, there is a review meeting to discuss what is in the iteration and how the team will deliver it. At the end of the sprint, the review presents what has been accomplished and the retrospective identifies lessons learned..

questions.description: What is meant by “Yesterday’s Weather” in an Agile project?

answers.A: Teams work less well when it rains

answers.B: Keeping metrics of earlier work to help with future estimates

answers.C: Retrospectives should include less important topics such as the weather

answers.D: Estimating is as futile as predicting the weather

questions.explanation: This reference refers to keeping metrics of earlier work to help with future estimates. Keeping track of the team’s velocity through the use of burndown charts will help you to more accurately estimate the team’s velocity on the next Iteration or project.

Project progress is measured through velocity. Velocity is an extremely simple and powerful method for accurately measuring the rate at which teams consistently deliver business value. To calculate velocity, simply add up the estimates of the features successfully delivered in an iteration -- probably in story points, but may be ideal days.

questions.description: In the popular prioritization technique called “MoSCoW”, the “M” stands for:
questions.explanation: When working with stories from a product backlog especially during release planning, instead of ranking them numerically, apply the Must Have; Should Have; Could Have; Won't Have rule to each story. Ask the product owner to write an M, S, C or W in front of every story.

answers.B: The progress of the work and features completed

answers.C: The number of hours worked after dark

answers.D: The rate of reduction of budget for a project

questions.explanation: The burndown chart is a representation of the number of hours remaining for completion of a project; usually represented in chart form with points plotted on an x and y axis that map a downward trend of work left to do until burning down to zero.

answers.A: The rush during the last few weeks of the project

answers.B: A period of high productivity during the start of the project

questions.explanation: A sprint is a “time-boxed” period of “potentially shippable” work. In Scrum, iterations are called sprints, and they are the most important sequences in the project. The Scrum project starts with a sprint planning meeting and ends with a sprint review and a sprint retrospective meeting.

questions.description: The reason for holding regular retrospectives is ...

answers.A: It allows the team to take a welcome break from work

answers.B: It gives management information to use in performance reviews

answers.C: It allows learning that can be used to improve team performance

answers.D: It prevents deviation from the process the team has been following

questions.explanation: It allows learning that can be used to improve team performance. One of the 12 principles behind the Agile Manifesto is, “At regular intervals, the team reflects on how to become more effective, then tunes and adjusts its behavior accordingly.”
